ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] crawler pausing itself !
ygData.msgSnippet: Heritrix will pause crawling if certain errors occur that are likely going to disrupt the crawl anyway. For example if an out of memory exception occurs. Also,

------=_NextPart_000_0001_01C570CF.5C71F300
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Heritrix will pause crawling if certain errors occur that are likely going
=
to disrupt the crawl anyway. For example if an out of memory exception
occu=
rs. Also, assuming you are using the appropriate processor, it will halt
wh=
en running out of disk space.
 
I suggest looking in the logs for possible =
errors. Most noticably the
heritrix_out.log and runtime-errors.log. Also th=
ere might be some Alerts if
you are using the WUI. 
 
If there are no indic=
ators of what went wrong in any of the logs, then
you've encountered a bran=
d now bug.
 
- Kris

-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoo=
groups.com
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Bjarne And=
ersen
Sent: 14. j=FAn=ED 2005 10:36
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Sub=
ject: [archive-crawler] crawler pausing itself !


Hi !

We're using heritr=
ix integrated into our own application - it works 
great - today I saw some=
thing very strange !
The crawler went into pause-mode all by itself
Any Ide=
as ? - can this happen unser cirtain circumstances ?
